quote: &ldquo;The room is warm and smells like dust, and just the presence of so many books makes it easier to breathe. It\'s remarkable how being around books, even those you\'ve never read, can have a calming effect, like walking into a crowded party and finding it full of people you know.&rdquo;
author: Mackenzi Lee

quote: &ldquo;To tell you the truth, I used to consider it a disgrace to be found ignorant by other people. But now, I find that I am not ashamed of knowing less than others, and I\'m less inclined to force myself to read books. In short, I have grown old and decrepit.&rdquo;
author: Natsume Sōseki

quote: &ldquo;Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.&rdquo;
author: Richard Steele

quote: &ldquo;I think that pretty much every form of fiction (I\'d include fantasy, obviously) can actually be a real escape from places where you feel bad, and from bad places. It can be a safe place you go, like going on holiday, and it can be somewhere that, while you\'ve escaped, actually teaches you things you need to know when you go back, that gives you knowledge and armour and tools to change the bad place you were in.<br /><br />So no, they\'re not escapist. They\'re escape.&rdquo;
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: &ldquo;This was the time in her life that she fell upon books as the only door out of her cell. They became half her world.&rdquo;
author: Michael Ondaatje

quote: &ldquo;The days weren\'t long enough for the reading she wanted to do.&rdquo;
author: Alan Bennett

quote: &ldquo;She turned to look at him, and he was already looking at her. \"I\'m going to miss you when I wake up,” she whispered, because she realized that she must have fallen asleep under the sun. Arin was too real for her imagination. He was a dream.<br />\"Don\'t wake up,” he said.&rdquo;
author: Marie Rutkoski

quote: &ldquo;The thought of these vast stacks of books would drive him mad: the more he read, the less he seemed to know - the greater the number of the books he read, the greater the immense uncountable number of those which he could never read would seem to be…. The thought that other books were waiting for him tore at his heart forever.&rdquo;
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: &ldquo;Have you never picked up a book you\'ve read before, and found it speaks to you in a new way?&rdquo;
author: Django Wexler

quote: &ldquo;Olly: jesus. is there a girl on this planet who doesn\'t love mr.darcy<br />Madeline: All girls love Mr. Darcy?<br />Olly: are you kidding? even my sister loves darcy and she doesn\'t love anybody<br />Madeline: She must love somebody. I\'m sure she loves you<br />Olly: what\'s so great about darcy?<br />Madeline: That\'s not a serious question<br />Olly: he\'s a snob<br />Madeline: But he overcomes it and eventually realizes that character matters more than class! He\'s a man open to learning life\'s lessons! Also, he\'s completely gorgeous and noble and brooding and poetic. Did I mention gorgeous? Also, he loves Elizabeth beyond all reason.&rdquo;
author: Nicola Yoon

quote: &ldquo;My brother and I were able to fantasize far more extravagantly about our parents\' tastes and desires, their aspirations and their vices, by scanning their bookcases than by snooping in their closest. Their selves were on their shelves.&rdquo;
author: Anne Fadiman

quote: &ldquo;Once you can write an alphabet, you can write a book of 100 million pages. It\'s just a matter of believing it as possible, and taking the cross millimetre by millimetre.&rdquo;
author: Israelmore Ayivor

quote: &ldquo;A book is more than the sum of its materials. It is an artifact of the human mind and hand.&rdquo;
author: Geraldine Brooks

quote: &ldquo;The venerable dead are waiting in my library to entertain me and relieve me from the nonsense of surviving mortals.&rdquo;
author: Samuel Davies

quote: &ldquo;What a vast fertility of pleasure books hold for me! I went in and found the table laden with books. I looked in and sniffed them all. I could not resist carrying this one off and broaching it. I think I could happily live here and read forever.&rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;A winner is not someone who wins. It\'s someone who tries and isn\'t afraid to lose.&rdquo;
author: Nusrat Sultana

quote: &ldquo;Books have their idiosyncrasies as well as people, and will not show me their full beauties unless the place and time in which they are read suits them.&rdquo;
author: Elizabeth von Arnim

quote: &ldquo;Pinapakita nyong mga dayuhang libro pa rin at mga dayuhang libro lang ang tinatangkilik ng mga tao. Bakit magsusugal ang mga publisher sa Pilipinong manunulat kung hindi naman pala mabili ang mga kwentong isinusulat ng mga Pilipino? At kung walang mga publisher na tatanggap ng mga trabaho ng mga Pilipinong manunulat, sino pa ang gugustong magsulat? Kung walang magsusulat, ano ang kahihinatnan ng panitikan sa bansa at sa kakayanan nating bumasa\'t sumulat?&rdquo;
author: Bob Ong

quote: &ldquo;More and more I lived in books, they were my comfort, refuge, addiction, compensation for the humiliations that attended contact with the world outside.&rdquo;
author: Lorna Sage

quote: &ldquo;My life - my personality, my habits, even my speech - is a combination of the books I choose to read, the people I choose to listen to, and the thoughts I choose to tolerate in my mind&rdquo;
author: Andy Andrews

quote: &ldquo;I am a machine condemned to devour books.&rdquo;
author: Karl Marx

quote: &ldquo;All that mankind has done, thought, gained, or been; it is lying as in magic preservation in the pages of books.&rdquo;
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: &ldquo;I am reading <i>The Lord of the Rings</i>. I suddenly wanted to. I almost know it by heart, but I can still sink right into it. I know no other book that is so much like going on a journey. When I put it down to this, I feel as if I am also waiting with Pippin for the echoes of that stone down the well.&rdquo;
author: Jo Walton

quote: &ldquo;We are liable to miss the best of life if we do not know how to tingle, if we do not learn to hoist ourselves just a little higher than we generally are in order to sample the rarest and ripest fruit of art which human thought has to offer.&rdquo;
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: &ldquo;I think it is good that books still exist, but they do make me sleepy.&rdquo;
author: Frank Zappa

quote: &ldquo;Reading a novel, War and Peace for example, is no Catnap. Because a novel is so long, reading one is like being married forever to somebody nobody knows or cares about.&rdquo;
author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

quote: &ldquo;I still remember the day my father took me to the Cemetery of Forgotten Books for the first time.&rdquo;
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: &ldquo;She did not care very much for other little girls, but if she had plenty of books she could console herself.&rdquo;
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

quote: &ldquo;The sun loved me again when it saw that the stars would not abandon me.&rdquo;
author: Jenim Dibie

quote: &ldquo;Overall, the library held a hushed exultation, as though the cherished volumes were all singing soundlessly within their covers.&rdquo;
author: Diana Gabaldon

quote: &ldquo;As for being poisoned by a book, there is no such thing as that. Art has no influence upon action. It annihilates the desire to act. It is superbly sterile. The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.&rdquo;
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: &ldquo;There will be more words written on Twitter in the next two years than contained in all books ever printed.&rdquo;
author: Christian Rudder

quote: &ldquo;In fiction, beauty was run-of-the-mill.&rdquo;
author: Eileen Favorite

quote: &ldquo;Even prisoners can escape if they have books.&rdquo;
author: Michelle Moran

quote: &ldquo;Reading is important.<br />Books are important.<br />Librarians are important. (Also, libraries are not child-care facilities, but sometimes feral children raise themselves among the stacks.)&rdquo;
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: &ldquo;No one knows as well as I how much nonsense is printed in books.&rdquo;
author: Julia Quinn

quote: &ldquo;All that is necessary for a student is access to a library.&rdquo;
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: &ldquo;Nestled in the cabbage leaves,<br />bunny\'s snuggly and sound asleep&rdquo;
author: Suzy  Davies

quote: &ldquo;The goal of this book is to triple the size of your To Be Read pile. It\'s a literary Wunderkammer, connecting you with books you might love for all kinds of reasons―because the subject speaks to you, because you found it through a great local library, or because there is a cute cat on the cover. Like a portable, beloved bookstore with aisles full of passionate shelftalkers, this volume contains for everyone who enters. Each time you open it, you\'ll find another jewel you didn\'t you needed to find until that moment.&rdquo;
author: Jane Mount

quote: &ldquo;He wanted to tell her she\'d have more room if she\'d just get rid of her books, but he supposed that in her case, it would be like telling a mother she\'d have more room if she threw out her children.&rdquo;
author: Cynthia Hand

quote: &ldquo;An author\'s great day is releasing your book into the world like a butterfly and having a reviewer come upon it and say…oh, that\'s lovely!&rdquo;
author: Nanette L. Avery

quote: &ldquo;I love men, I love books, I can\'t get enough of them.&rdquo;
author: Philip Hensher

quote: &ldquo;Books are borrowed minds, and because they capture the soul of a people, they explore and celebrate all it means to be human.&rdquo;
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: &ldquo;If you ask me, I think the first multi-dimensional-space-time traveling device man invented was centuries ago. And they called this device a Book.&rdquo;
author: Malcolm Fernandes

quote: &ldquo;The universe is the largest, the thickest and the most necessary book! Either we read this book down to the finest detail and consolidate our position in the universe, or we fall upside down like a climber who doesn\'t take enough precautions against the dangers of the mountain!&rdquo;
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: &ldquo;We have everything we need to be happy but we aren\'t happy. Something is missing...<br />It is not books you need, it\'s some of the things that are in books. The magic is only in what books say, how they stitched the patches of the universe together into one garment for us.&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;How many cities have revealed themselves to me in the marches I undertook in the pursuit of books!&rdquo;
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: &ldquo;Reading teaches me the answers to the problems I haven\'t had yet, or to problems I didn\'t even know how to describe. And when I feel less alone with what troubles me, it is easier to find solutions. A book to me is like a friend, a shelter, advice, an argument with someone who cares enough to argue with me for a better answer than the one we both already have. Books aren\'t just a door to another world-each book is part of a door to the whole world, a door that always has more behind it.&rdquo;
author: Alexander Chee

quote: &ldquo;I\'m the book lady. With the bag. I\'ve secured Botha The book and the bag.&rdquo;
author: Jill Telford

quote: &ldquo;Unless you find yourself in a book, you have a hard time finding anybody else.&rdquo;
author: Aidan Chambers

quote: &ldquo;Tante pagine sublimi sono state date alle fiamme, mentre questi documenti schifosi stanno ancora qui nella mia biblioteca.&rdquo;
author: Antoine Volodine

quote: &ldquo;I wanted fo have my books around me, forming a totem pole of the narratives I\'d visited.&rdquo;
author: Susan Orlean

quote: &ldquo;Literary detection and firearms don\'t really go hand in hand; pen mighter than the sword and so forth. &rdquo;
author: Jasper Fforde

quote: &ldquo;Imagination is a gift given to us from God and each one of us use it differently.&rdquo;
author: Brian Jacques

quote: &ldquo;Any book worth banning is a book worth reading.&rdquo;
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: &ldquo;I wanted to have my books around me, forming a totem pole of the narratives I\'d visited.&rdquo;
author: Susan Orlean

quote: &ldquo;Your house, being the place in which you read, can tell us the position books occupy in your life, if they are a defense you set up to keep the outside world at a distance, if they are a dream into which you sink as if into a drug, or bridges you cast toward the outside, toward the world that interests you so much that you want to multiply and extend its dimensions through books.&rdquo;
author: Italo Calvino

quote: &ldquo;For once the disease of reading has laid upon the system it weakens so that it falls an easy prey to that other scourge which dwells in the ink pot and festers in the quill. The wretch takes to writing. &rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;The reading of a book was a journey. There was no need for souvenirs.&rdquo;
author: Susan Orlean

quote: &ldquo;Books are a sort of cultural DNA, the code for who, as a society, we are, and what we know.&rdquo;
author: Susan Orlean

quote: &ldquo;[Quoting a letter by Charles F. Lummis]: books are the last things that any human being can afford to do without.&rdquo;
author: Susan Orlean

quote: &ldquo;Oft times I write with my own blood in pain,a quick release of freedom to express well,the woes of past and present by views train;while my fancies unbar from my soul\'s hall.&rdquo;
author: Nithin Purple

quote: &ldquo;Si ha sempre fretta di essere felici, signor Danglars, perchè quando uno ha sofferto a lungo, stenta a credere alla felicità.&rdquo;
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: &ldquo;And who are you really, Tallis? Are you going to be the hero of Selkirk, rather than its monster? A promise of hope, rather than a warning of darker things to come?&rdquo;
author: C.E. Clayton

quote: &ldquo;An infinite supply of paper, to be sure, but nothing more than paper, strewn with marks like debris from an explosion.&rdquo;
author: Traci Chee

quote: &ldquo;I do, I\'m afraid, understand books far more readily than I understand people. Books are so easy to get along with.&rdquo;
author: Katherine Rundell

quote: &ldquo;Ah! stir well your fancy, fear not to tell me those deep heart secrets now,look the sun goes down the high hills and by the tree shades we sat,in adored pose;along side the lake we sat,kissed by the winds nigh.&rdquo;
author: Nithin Purple

quote: &ldquo;One is never alone with a book nearby, don\'t you agree? Every page reminds us of a day that has passed and makes us relive the emotions that filled it. Happy hours underlined in red pencil, dark ones in black...&rdquo;
author: Arturo Pérez-Reverte

quote: &ldquo;It [the book] was spinning a magic spell around her heart, sticky as a spider\'s web and enchantingly beautiful..&rdquo;
author: Cornelia Funke

quote: &ldquo;Tampaknya hanya buku yang paling pantas diceritakan dengan bangga oleh manusia beradab, bukan BMW, Mercedes, ataupun Volvo. Apabila ada manusia di zaman sekarang yang menyebut dirinya modern tetapi tidak mengindahkan buku, memilikinya, dan membacanya, maka dengan demikian manusia tersebut telah mengambil inisiatif menjadikan dirinya sebagai hewan.&rdquo;
author: Remy Sylado

quote: &ldquo;I took the volume to a table, opened its soft, ivory pages... and fell into it as into a pool during dry season.&rdquo;
author: Janet Fitch

quote: &ldquo;A breeze, a forgotten summer, a smile, all can fit into a storefront window.&rdquo;
author: Dejan Stojanovic
city: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca

quote: &ldquo;A book is a fragile creature, it suffers the wear of time, it fears rodents, the elements and clumsy hands. so the librarian protects the books not only against mankind but also against nature and devotes his life to this war with the forces of oblivion.&rdquo;
author: Umberto Eco

quote: &ldquo;A book has but one voice, but it does not instruct everyone alike.&rdquo;
author: Thomas à Kempis

quote: &ldquo;The ultimate luxury is to reread: to revisit a book to see how time has treated it, how memory has distorted it, or how my own passing years have cast a new light on it.&rdquo;
author: Michael Upchurch

quote: &ldquo;I didn\'t go to bookshops to buy. That\'s a little bourgeois. I went because they were civilized places. It made me happy there were people who sat down and wrote and wrote and wrote and there were other people who devoted their lives to making those words into books. It was lovely. Like standing in the middle of civilization.&rdquo;
author: Jerry Pinto

quote: &ldquo;I was with book, as a woman is with child.&rdquo;
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: &ldquo;The person who deserves most pity is a lonesome one on a rainy day who doesn\'t know how to read.&rdquo;
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: &ldquo;Personally, I am a hedonistic reader; I have never read a book merely because it was ancient. I read books for the aesthetic emotions they offer me, and I ignore the commentaries and criticism.&rdquo;
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: &ldquo;The ability to read awoke inside of me some long dormant craving to be mentally alive.&rdquo;
author: Malcolm X

quote: &ldquo;My parents would frisk me before family events. Before weddings, funerals, bar mitzvahs, and what have you. Because if they didn\'t, then the book would be hidden inside some pocket or other and as soon as whatever it was got under way I\'d be found in a corner. That was who I was...that was what I did. I was the kid with the book.&rdquo;
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: &ldquo;We owe it to each other to tell stories.&rdquo;
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: &ldquo;A good story is always more dazzling than a broken piece of truth.&rdquo;
author: Diane Setterfield

quote: &ldquo;Who is better off? The one who writes to revel in the voluptuousness of the life that surrounds them? Or the one who writes to escape the tediousness of that which awaits them outside? Whose flame will last longer?&rdquo;
author: Roman Payne

quote: &ldquo;Myrna could spend happy hours browsing bookcases. She felt if she could just get a good look at a person\'s bookcase and their grocery cart, she\'d pretty much know who they were.&rdquo;
author: Louise Penny

quote: &ldquo;Historical novels are, without question, the best way of teaching history, for they offer the human stories behind the events and leave the reader with a desire to know more.&rdquo;
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: &ldquo;I\'m old-fashioned and think that reading books is the most glorious pastime that humankind has yet devised.&rdquo;
author: Wisława Szymborska

quote: &ldquo;Probably all of us, writers and readers alike, set out into exile, or at least into a certain kind of exile, when we leave childhood behind...The immigrant, the nomad, the traveler, the sleepwalker all exist, but not the exile, since every writer becomes an exile simply by venturing into literature, and every reader becomes an exile simply by opening a book.&rdquo;
author: Roberto Bolaño

quote: &ldquo;my boy? <br />he is even<br />better than <br />books. <br />-fiction has nothing on you.&rdquo;
author: Amanda Lovelace

quote: &ldquo;Writers are the exorcists of their own demons.&rdquo;
author: Mario Vargas Llosa

quote: &ldquo;There is no scent so pleasant to my nostrils as that faint, subtle reek which comes from an ancient book.&rdquo;
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: &ldquo;Real lives have no end. Real books have no end.&rdquo;
author: J.M.G. Le Clézio

quote: &ldquo;All told, she owned fourteen books, but she saw her story as being made up predominantly of ten of them. Of those ten, six were stolen, one showed up at the kitchen table, two were made for her by a hidden Jew, and one was delivered by a soft, yellow-dressed afternoon.&rdquo;
author: Markus Zusak

quote: &ldquo;To limit the press is to insult a nation; to prohibit reading of certain books is to declare the inhabitants to be either fools or slaves: such a prohibition ought to fill them with disdain.&rdquo;
author: Claude Adrien Helvétius

quote: &ldquo;To care about words, to have a stake in what is written, to believe in the power of books - this overwhelms the rest, and beside it one\'s life becomes very small.&rdquo;
author: Paul Auster

quote: &ldquo;I shall keep my book on the table here, and read a little every morning as soon as I wake, for I know it will do me good, and help me through the day.&rdquo;
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: &ldquo;Books, which we mistake for consolation, only add depth to our sorrow. &rdquo;
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: &ldquo;So -- I confess I have been a rake at reading. I have read those things which I ought not to have read, and I have not read those things which I ought to have read, and there is no health in me -- if by health you mean an inclusive and coherent knowledge of any body of great literature. I can only protest, like all rakes in their shameful senescence, that I have had a good time.&rdquo;
author: Robertson Davies

quote: &ldquo;A book,<br />a book full<br />of human touches,<br />of shirts,<br />a book<br />without loneliness, with men<br />and tools,<br />a book<br />is victory.&rdquo;
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: &ldquo;There were thousands of brown books in leather bindings, some chained to the book-shelves and others propped against each other as if they had had too much to drink and did not really trust themselves. These gave out a smell of must and solid brownness which was most secure.&rdquo;
author: T.H. White

quote: &ldquo;I wish we could sometimes love the characters in real life as we love the characters in romances. There are a great many human souls whom we should accept more kindly, and even appreciate more clearly, if we simply thought of them as people in a story.&rdquo;
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: &ldquo;Home is where your books are.&rdquo;
author: Kerstin Gier

quote: &ldquo;If you want to really know something you have to observe or experience it in person; if you claim to know something on the basis of hearsay, or on happening to see it in a book, you\'ll be a laughingstock to those who really know.&rdquo;
author: Jonathan D. Spence

quote: &ldquo;We have inhabited both the actual and the imaginary realms for a long time. But we don\'t live in either place the way our parents or ancestors did. Enchantment alters with age, and with the age.<br />We know a dozen Arthurs now, all of them true. The Shire changed irrevocably even in Bilbo\'s lifetime. Don Quixote went riding out to Argentina and met Jorge Luis Borges there. Plus c\'est la même chose, plus ça change.&rdquo;
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: &ldquo;There was a time in the ancient world - a very long time - in which the central cultural problem must have seemed an inexhaustible outpouring of books. Where to put them all? How to organize them on the groaning shelves? How to hold the profusion of knowledge in one\'s head? The loss of this plenitude would have been virtually inconceivable to anyone living in its midst.<br /> Then, not all at once but with the cumulative force of a mass extinction, the whole enterprise came to an end. What looked stable turned out to be fragile, and what had seemed for all time was only for the time being.&rdquo;
author: Stephen Greenblatt

quote: &ldquo;This place is a mystery. A sanctuary. Every book, every volume you see, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it &amp; the soul of those who read it &amp; lived it &amp; dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down it\'s pages, it\'s spirit grows &amp; strengthens. In this place, books no longer remembered by anyone, books that are lost in time, live forever, waiting for the day when they will reach a new reader\'s hands, a new spirit...&rdquo;
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: &ldquo;Reading a novel, he supposes, is like playing a game where all the choices have been made for you ahead of time by someone who is much better at this particular game. (Though he sometimes wishes choose-your-own-adventure novels would come back into fashion.)&rdquo;
author: Erin Morgenstern

quote: &ldquo;I was never very good with either my hands or feet. It always seemed to me they\'d just been stuck on as an afterthought during my making. Dreams didn\'t translate through sports, or music, dancing, carpentry, plumbing. I was the bookish kid, more at home in the pages of a fantasy than in the room in the town on the planet.&rdquo;
author: Steve Rasnic Tem

quote: &ldquo;Neither novels or their readers benefit from any attempts to divine whether any facts hide inside a story. Such efforts attack the very idea that made-up stories can matter, which is sort of the foundational assumption of our species.&rdquo;
author: John Green

quote: &ldquo;It\'s important to read a book, but also to hold the book, to smell the book... it\'s perfume, it\'s incense, it\'s the dust of Egypt...&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;Now may this little Book a blessing be<br />To those that love this little Book, and me:<br />And may its Buyer have no cause to say,<br />His money is but lost, or thrown away.&rdquo;
author: John Bunyan

quote: &ldquo;And there are always those who would watch Alexandria burn.<br />There always have been. There always will be.&rdquo;
author: Erin Morgenstern

quote: &ldquo;Books are humanity in print.&rdquo;
author: Barbara W. Tuchman

quote: &ldquo;I have been stuck in the business of books for so long, I forgot how much fun being a part of a story can be.&rdquo;
author: Kiersten White

quote: &ldquo;The reality of a serious writer is a reality of many voices, some of them belonging to the writer, some of them belonging to the world of readers at large.&rdquo;
author: The reality of a serious writer is a reality of many voices, some of them

quote: &ldquo;You see, unlike in the movies, there is no THE END sign flashing at the end of books. When I\'ve read a book, I don\'t feel like I\'ve finished anything. So I start a new one.&rdquo;
author: Elif Shafak

quote: &ldquo;But he spends so much time in front of screens he has a near-compulsive need to let his eyeballs rest on paper.&rdquo;
author: Erin Morgenstern

quote: &ldquo;I would not sacrifice a single living mesquite tree for any book ever written. One square mile of living desert is worth a hundred \'great books\' - and one brave deed is worth a thousand.&rdquo;
author: Edward Abbey

quote: &ldquo;I certainly couldn\'t have survived my childhood without books. All that deprivation and pain--abuse, broken home, a runaway sister, a brother with cancer--the books allowed me to withstand. They sustained me. I read still, prolifically, with great passion, but never like I read in those days: in those days it was life or death.&rdquo;
author: Junot Díaz

quote: &ldquo;Just as I\'m all the ages I have been, I\'m all the readers I have been.&rdquo;
author: Anne Bogel

quote: &ldquo;If there is no mystery, for the artist, to solve inside of his art, then there\'s no point in it. . . . for me, every act of art is the act of solving a mystery.&rdquo;
author: Truman Capote

quote: &ldquo;From whichever side I start, I think I am in an old place where others have been before me.&rdquo;
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: &ldquo;His hands were weak and shaking from carrying far too many books from the bookshop. It was the best feeling.&rdquo;
author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

quote: &ldquo;Reading is perhaps the greatest pleasure you will have in life; the one you will think of longest, and repent of least.&rdquo;
author: William Hazlitt

quote: &ldquo;You\'ll grow devilish fat upon this paper-diet!&rdquo;
author: William Congreve

quote: &ldquo;When someone gives me either a democratic or republican pamphlet, I throw it in their face. I\'m a librarian, damn it! We only take book donations.&rdquo;
author: Bauvard

quote: &ldquo;Every book is a different hood, a different country, a different world. Reading is how I visit places and people and ideas. And when something rings true or if I still have a question, I outline it with a bright yellow highlighter so that it\'s lit up in my mind, like a lightbulb or a torch leading the way to somewhere new.&rdquo;
author: Ibi Zoboi

quote: &ldquo;The most important things in our intimate lives can\'t be discussed with strangers, except in books.&rdquo;
author: Edmund White

quote: &ldquo;But really it says everything that\'s wrong about the publishing industry, that a quarter of a million people bought and read a sex and shopping novel that wasn\'t even written by one of those footballer girlfriends, and yet most of the shortlisted titles on the Orange Prize, which is an award for women writers, don\'t even sell ten thousand copies. It\'s just not right.&rdquo;
author: Sarra Manning

quote: &ldquo;There was another reason [she] took her books whenever they went away. They were her home when she was somewhere strange. They were familiar voices, friends that never quarreled with her, clever, powerful friends -- daring and knowledgeable, tried and tested adventurers who had traveled far and wide. Her books cheered her up when she was sad and kept her from being bored.&rdquo;
author: Cornelia Funke

quote: &ldquo;They would debate every subject under the infinite karoo sky, from the time the chameleons stalked the sun, to when the crickets began their nocturnal orchestra.&rdquo;
author: Bianca Bowers

quote: &ldquo;In fact, when I finally shuffle off this mortal<br />coil, you will have to pry a book out of my cold, dead hands.&rdquo;
author: Michael Cart

quote: &ldquo;Lo poco que entiendo de la vida es por leer libros&rdquo;
author: Magalí Tajes Parga

quote: &ldquo;In her spare time, she looked to books or the stars for company.&rdquo;
author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia

quote: &ldquo;If you surround yourself with the good and righteous, they can only raise you up. If you surround yourself with the others, they will drag you down into the doldrums of mediocrity, and they will keep you there, but only as long as you permit it.&rdquo;
author: Mark Glamack

quote: &ldquo;I don\'t know why we stopped reading together, but gradually we were not doing it regularly, and then without realizing it was happening we were reading different books, and gradually we came not to care about the book the other one was reading, because it was not the book we were reading, and we became bored and drifted off when the other one talked about his book. What we were doing, reading different books, was furnishing different rooms, constructing separate worlds almost, in which we could sit and be ourselves again. Of course those were rooms in which we each sat alone, and we gradually spent more and more time in them and less and less in the house we lived in together.&rdquo;
author: Sam Savage

quote: &ldquo;If I were a Dr., I\'d prescribe books. They can be just as powerful as drugs.&rdquo;
author: Shane Parrish

quote: &ldquo;Reading is a majority skill but a minority art.&rdquo;
author: Julian Barnes

quote: &ldquo;Books were made for healing and learning and growing and completely removing yourself from real life and plopping down into a fantasy world.&rdquo;
author: Nash Summers

quote: &ldquo;Use more caution the next time you make a reading selection. Books, you know, are a lot like people, and each and every one of us is ultimately judged by the company we keep&rdquo;
author: Ethan Russell Erway

quote: &ldquo;It had been startling and disappointing to me to find out that story books had been written by people, that books were not natural wonders, coming up of themselves like grass. Yet regardless of where they come from, I cannot remember a time when I was not in love with them -- with the books themselves, cover and binding and the paper they were printed on, with their smell and their weight and with their possession in my arms, captured and carried off to myself. Still illiterate, I was ready for them, committed to all the reading I could give them ...&rdquo;
author: Eudora Welty

quote: &ldquo;There is something fascinatingly awkward about an author photo. I\'m drawn to those glossy shots in the back of books, mostly because the subjects never look happy to be there.&rdquo;
author: Pamela Ribon

quote: &ldquo;The best aspect of my invisible friend was the help they gave me in writing books.&rdquo;
author: Steven Magee

quote: &ldquo;One of the curious aspects of my invisible friend was they would assist me in writing books.&rdquo;
author: Steven Magee

quote: &ldquo;Books have always been among my most trusted of friends, Mr. Linden replied. The best of them allow the mind to wander wherever the author\'s musings lead.&rdquo;
author: Walter Dean Myers

quote: &ldquo;A learned man is a sedentary, concentrated solitary enthusiast, who searches through books to discover some particular grain of truth upon which he has set his heart. If the passion for reading conquers him, his gains dwindle and vanish between his fingers. A reader, on the other hand, must check the desire for learning at the outset; if knowledge sticks to him well and good, but to go in pursuit of it, to read on a system, to become a specialist or an authority, is very apt to kill what suits us to consider the more humane passion for pure and disinterested reading.&rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;A book is a device to ignite the imagination.&rdquo;
author: Alan Bennett

quote: &ldquo;In the absence of real society, I made my own out of the imagined people Peter Flynt slid into my locker. They entered like corpses on a slab, but they came to life in my mind with each turn of the page.&rdquo;
author: Erin Bartels

quote: &ldquo;They were the sisterhood: their mothers at a younger age.&rdquo;
author: Ann Brashares

quote: &ldquo;What refuge is there for the victim who is oppressed with the feeling that there are a thousand new books he ought to read, while life is only long enough for him to attempt to read a hundred?&rdquo;
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

quote: &ldquo;Come tender as the trees<br />forgiving the books<br />for asking to be made.&rdquo;
author: Andrea Gibson

quote: &ldquo;Never Let anyone tell you that you can\'t; show them that you can.&rdquo;
author: Gloria Mallette

quote: &ldquo;In the sea of words, the <i>in print</i> is foam, surf bubbles riding the top. And it\'s a dark sea, and deep, where divers need lights on their helmets and would perish at the lower depths.&rdquo;
author: Jonathan Lethem

quote: &ldquo;I cannot BELIEVE the nerve of some people, dog-earing the pages of the books! Do they think they OWN the books? I think you should give a bookmark to every single person who checks out a book. I mean it. THEY ARE RUINING EVERYTHING! I will help make the bookmarks if that\'s what it takes.&rdquo;
author: Gina Sheridan

quote: &ldquo;I have often reflected upon the new vistas that reading opened to me. I knew right there, in prison, that reading had changed forever the course of my life. As I see it today, the ability to read awoke inside me some long dormant craving to be mentally alive. I certainly wasn\'t seeking any degree, the way a college confers a status symbol upon its students. My home made education gave me, with every additional book that I read, a little bit more sensitivity to the deafness, dumbness, and blindness that was afflicting the black race in America. Not long ago, an English writer telephoned me from London asking questions. One was, \"What\'s your alma mater?” I told him, \"Books.” You will never catch me with a free fifteen minutes in which I\'m not studying something I feel might be able to help the black man.&rdquo;
author: Malcolm X

quote: &ldquo;We are the people of the book. We love our books. We fill our houses with books. We treasure books we inherit from our parents, and we cherish the idea of passing those books on to our children. Indeed, how many of us started reading with a beloved book that belonged to one of our parents? We force worthy books on our friends, and we insist that they read them. We even feel a weird kinship for the people we see on buses or airplanes reading our books, the books that we claim. If anyone tries to take away our books-some oppressive government, some censor gone off the rails-we would defend them with everything that we have. We know our tribespeople when we visit their homes because every wall is lined with books. There are teetering piles of books beside the bed and on the floor; there are masses of swollen paperbacks in the bathroom. Our books are us. They are our outboard memory banks and they contain the moral, intellectual, and imaginative influences that make us the people we are today.&rdquo;
author: Cory Doctorow

quote: &ldquo;Books want to burn,\' he says. \'They go up like that because - they\'re unstable, memories don\'t <i>want</i> to stay...&rdquo;
author: Bridget Collins

quote: &ldquo;I have always found that making allowances for a liberal amount of fiction in one\'s life is necessary to maintaining equanimity. How else does one escape, even for a short time, from the drudgery that everyday life affords?&rdquo;
author: Maria Grace

quote: &ldquo;El libro es jardín que se puede llevar en el bolsillo, nave espacial que viaja en la mochila, arma para enfrentar las mejores batallas y afrentar a los peores enemigos, semilla de libertad, pañuelo para las lágrimas. El libro es cama mullida y cama de clavos, el libro te obliga a pensar, a sonreír, a llorar, a enojarte ante lo injusto y aplaudir la venganza de los justos. El libro es comida, techo, asiento, ropa que me arropa, boca que besa mi boca. Lugar que contiene el universo.&rdquo;
author: Benito Taibo

quote: &ldquo;Isana had never understood men who made it a point to put trophies of their hunts on the walls. Gaius\'s study, its walls lines with the carcasses of books he had torn open and devoured, reminded her of nothing so much as old Aldo\'s hunting lodge, back in the Calderon Valley, and she thought it only marginally less boastful.&rdquo;
author: Jim Butcher

quote: &ldquo;...ending a book with a sequel in such a way that the reader still has faith in the characters and in the writer. That\'s finesse.&rdquo;
author: Shandy L. Kurth

quote: &ldquo;I gave him my best cryptic smile. He did not fall down to his feet, kiss my shoes, and promise me the world. I must be getting rusty.&rdquo;
author: Ilona Andrews

quote: &ldquo;I told myself that as long as there were books I could be sure of being happy.&rdquo;
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: &ldquo;For books are more than books, they are the life, the very heart and core of ages past, the reason why men worked and died, the essence and quintessence of their lives.&rdquo;
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: &ldquo;Books, on the other hand … you borrow from a library until you find the book you love, and then you keep it. The library won\'t let you borrow more books until you return it, but you never return it because you\'ll never need any other book&rdquo;
author: Eden Finley

quote: &ldquo;Geeks are not the world\'s rowdiest people. We\'re quiet and introspective, and usually more comfortable communing with our keyboards or a good book than each other. Our idea of how to paint the<br />Emerald City red involves light liquor, heavy munchies, and marathon sessions of video games of the ‘giant robots shooting each other and everything else in sight\' variety. We debate competing lines of software or gaming consoles with passion, and dissect every movie, television show, and novel in the science fiction, fantasy, and horror genres.<br /><br />With as many of us as there are in this town, people inevitably find ways to cater to us when we get in the mood to spend our hard-earned dollars. Downtown Seattle boasts grandiose geek magnets, like the Experience Music Project and the Experience Science Fiction museum, but it has much humbler and far more obscure attractions too, like the place we all went to for our ship party that evening: a hole-in-the-wall bar called the Electric Penguin on Capitol Hill. &rdquo;
author: Angela Korra'ti

quote: &ldquo;… Becoming a reader is a change for the better. Trust me. No one has ever lost by becoming addicted to stories – to the lessons learned by those who possess enough courage to put pen to paper.&rdquo;
author: Ellery Adams

quote: &ldquo;Without libraries what have we? We have no past and no future.&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;You want to remember that while you\'re judging the book, the book is also judging you.&rdquo;
author: Stephen King

quote: &ldquo;Fill your house with stacks of books, in all the crannies and all the nooks.&rdquo;
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: &ldquo;It is clear that the books owned the shop rather than the other way about. Everywhere they had run wild and taken possession of their habitat, breeding and multiplying, and clearly lacking any strong hand to keep them down.&rdquo;
author: Agatha Christie

quote: &ldquo;What we become depends on what we read after all of the professors have finished with us. The greatest university of all is a collection of books.&rdquo;
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: &ldquo;There were valuable first editions of books in the enormous library, most of them had been scribbled in by some idiot named Will H.&rdquo;
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: &ldquo;Books can not be killed by fire. People die, but books never die. No man and no force can abolish memory... In this war, we know, books are weapons. And it is a part of your dedication always to make them weapons for man\'s freedom.&rdquo;
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: &ldquo;If this nation is to be wise as well as strong, if we are to achieve our destiny, then we need more new ideas for more wise men reading more good books in more public libraries. These libraries should be open to all-except the censor. We must know all the facts and hear all the alternatives and listen to all the criticisms. Let us welcome controversial books and controversial authors. For the Bill of Rights is the guardian of our security as well as our liberty.<br /><br /><i>[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]</i>&rdquo;
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: &ldquo;She breathed deeply of the scent of decaying fiction, disintegrating history, and forgotten verse, and she observed for the first time that a room full of books smelled like dessert: a sweet snack made of figs, vanilla, glue, and cleverness.&rdquo;
author: Joe Hill

quote: &ldquo;When male authors write love stories, the heroine tends to end up dead.&rdquo;
author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

quote: &ldquo;Because when I read, I don\'t really read; I pop a beautiful sentence into my mouth and suck it like a fruit drop, or I sip it like a liqueur until the thought dissolves in me like alcohol, infusing brain and heart and coursing on through the veins to the root of each blood vessel.&rdquo;
author: Bohumil Hrabal

quote: &ldquo;A good book is the precious life-blood of a master spirit, embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life.&rdquo;
author: John Milton

quote: &ldquo;When I am king they shall not have bread and shelter only, but also teachings out of books, for a full belly is little worth where the mind is starved.&rdquo;
author: Mark Twain

quote: &ldquo;Often on a wet day I begin counting up; what I\'ve read and what I haven\'t read.&rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;Reading is not an end to itself, but a means to an end.&rdquo;
author: Adolf Hitler

quote: &ldquo;Some say life is the thing, but I prefer reading.&rdquo;
author: Ruth Rendell

quote: &ldquo;She closed the book and put her cheek against it. There was still an odor of a library on it, of dust, leather, binding glue, and old paper, one book carrying the smell of hundreds.&rdquo;
author: Shannon Hale

quote: &ldquo;Books... are like lobster shells, we surround ourselves with \'em, then we grow out of \'em and leave \'em behind, as evidence of our earlier stages of development.&rdquo;
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: &ldquo;A story is not like a road to follow … it\'s more like a house. You go inside and stay there for a while, wandering back and forth and settling where you like and discovering how the room and corridors relate to each other, how the world outside is altered by being viewed from these windows. And you, the visitor, the reader, are altered as well by being in this enclosed space, whether it is ample and easy or full of crooked turns, or sparsely or opulently furnished. You can go back again and again, and the house, the story, always contains more than you saw the last time. It also has a sturdy sense of itself of being built out of its own necessity, not just to shelter or beguile you.&rdquo;
author: Alice Munro

quote: &ldquo;One day, she ventured to the palace library and was delighted to find what good company books could be.&rdquo;
author: E. Lockhart

quote: &ldquo;There are metaphors more real than the people who walk in the street. There are images tucked away in books that live more vividly than many men and women. There are phrases from literary works that have a positively human personality. There are passages from my own writing that chill me with fright, so distinctly do I feel them as people, so sharply outlined do they appear against the walls of my room, at night, in shadows... I\'ve written sentences whose sound, read out loud or silently (impossible to hide their sound), can only be of something that acquired absolute exteriority and a full-fledged soul.&rdquo;
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: &ldquo;Thus I rediscovered what writers have always known (and have told us again and again): books always speak of other books, and every story tells a story that has already been told.&rdquo;
author: Umberto Eco

quote: &ldquo;I\'m trying to undermine the basis of Christian belief... I\'m not in the business of offending people. I find the books upholding certain values that I think are important, such as life is immensely valuable and this world is an extraordinarily beautiful place. We should do what we can to increase the amount of wisdom in the world.<br /><br />[<i>Washington Post interview, 19 February 2001</i>]&rdquo;
author: Philip Pullman

quote: &ldquo;When you sell a man a book you don\'t sell just twelve ounces of paper and ink and glue - you sell him a whole new life. Love and friendship and humour and ships at sea by night - there\'s all heaven and earth in a book, a real book.&rdquo;
author: Christopher  Morley

quote: &ldquo;My youngest brother had a wonderful schtick from some time in high school, through to graduating medicine. He had a card in his wallet that read, ‘If I am found with amnesia, please give me the following books to read …\' And it listed half a dozen books where he longed to recapture that first glorious sense of needing to find out ‘what happens next\' … the feeling that keeps you up half the night. The feeling that comes before the plot\'s been learned.&rdquo;
author: Guy Gavriel Kay

quote: &ldquo;I know there are people who don\'t read fiction at all, and I find it hard to understand how they can bear to be inside the same head all the time.&rdquo;
author: Diane Setterfield

quote: &ldquo;The unread story is not a story; it is little black marks on wood pulp. The reader, reading it, makes it live: a live thing, a story.&rdquo;
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: &ldquo;Books, the children of the brain.&rdquo;
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: &ldquo;How do you tell a dream from a nightmare? If it involves a book burning , it\'s probably a nightmare.&rdquo;
author: Rick Riordan

quote: &ldquo;People were noisome, demanding, judgmental. Books gave everything and asked nothing more than to be taken care of.&rdquo;
author: Sam Sykes

quote: &ldquo;Do you know why books such as this are so important? Because they have quality. And what does the word quality mean? To me it means texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can go under the microscope. You\'d find life under the glass, streaming past in infinite profusion. The more pores, the more truthfully recorded details of life per square inch you can get on a sheet of paper, the more ‘literary\' you are. That\'s my definition anyway. Telling detail. Fresh detail. The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies. So now you see why books are hated and feared? They show the pores in the face of life.&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;The taste for books was an early one. As a child he was sometimes found at midnight by a page still reading. They took his taper away, and he bred glow-worms to serve his purpose. They took the glow-worms away and he almost burnt the house down with a tinder.&rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;For books continue each other, in spite of our habit of judging them separately.&rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;There\'s nothing as cozy as a piece of candy and a book.&rdquo;
author: Betty MacDonald

quote: &ldquo;...Something we once loved, and love now, in the shape of a book. Maybe eBooks are going to take over, one day, but not until those whizzkids in Silicon Valley invent a way to bend the corners, fold the spine, yellow the pages, add a coffee ring or two and allow the plastic tablet to fall open at a favorite page.&rdquo;
author: Russell T. Davies

quote: &ldquo;I\'ve developed a great reputation for wisdom by ordering more books than I ever had time to read, and reading more books, by far, than I learned anything useful from, except, of course, that some very tedious gentlemen have written books.&rdquo;
author: Marilynne Robinson

quote: &ldquo;She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain&rdquo;
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: &ldquo;CUSTOMER: If I were to, say... meet the love of my life in this bookshop, what section do you think they would be standing in?&rdquo;
author: Jen Campbell

quote: &ldquo;You\'re either reading a book or you\'re not.&rdquo;
author: Jonathan Franzen

quote: &ldquo;This is the type of love story that deals with real fucking problems. It\'s a story about forgiveness and unconditional love, and it shows how much a person can change, really change, if they try hard enough. It\'s the type of story that proves that anything is fucking possible when it comes to self-recovery. It shows that if you have someone to lean on, someone who loves you and doesn\'t give up on you, you can find your way out of the darkness. It shows that no matter what type of parents you had, or addictions you were faced with, you can overcome anything that stands in your way and become a better person. That\'s the type of story After is.&rdquo;
author: Anna Todd

quote: &ldquo;Reading is sometimes thought of as a form of escapism, and it\'s a common turn of phrase to speak of getting lost in a book. But a book can also be where one finds oneself; and when a reader is grasped and held by a book, reading does not feel like an escape from life so much as it feels like an urgent, crucial dimension of life itself.&rdquo;
author: Rebecca Mead

quote: &ldquo;Few pleasures, for the true reader, rival the pleasure of browsing unhurriedly among books: old books, new books, library books, other people\'s books, one\'s own books - it does not matter whose or where. Simply to be among books, glancing at one here, reading a page from one over there, enjoying them all as objects to be touched, looked at, even smelt, is a deep satisfaction. And often, very often, while browsing haphazardly, looking for nothing in particular, you pick up a volume that suddenly excites you, and you know that this one of all the others you must read. Those are great moments - and the books we come across like that are often the most memorable.&rdquo;
author: Aidan Chambers

quote: &ldquo;There were two sets of double doors leading out of the antechamber, one marked STACKS and the other TOMES. Not knowing the difference between the two, I headed to the ones labeled STACKS. That was what I wanted. Stacks of books. Great heaps of books. Shelf after endless shelf of books.&rdquo;
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: &ldquo;The very best authors are no longer with us; so only read books written by dead people.&rdquo;
author: Kevin Ansbro

quote: &ldquo;The books are to remind us what asses and fools we are.&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;Our society accepts the book as a given, but the act of reading -- once considered useful and important, as well as potentially dangerous and subversive -- is now condescendingly accepted as a pastime, a slow pastime that lacks efficiency and does not contribute to the common good.&rdquo;
author: Alberto Manguel

quote: &ldquo;If anything attacked us, we could just panic at it until it went away.&rdquo;
author: Seanan McGuire

quote: &ldquo;A Book <br /><br />\"Now” - said a good book unto me -<br />\"Open my pages and you shall see<br />Jewels of wisdom and treasures fine,<br />Gold and silver in every line,<br />And you may claim them if you but will<br />Open my pages and take your fill.<br /><br />\"Open my pages and run them o\'er,<br />Take what you choose of my golden store.<br />Be you greedy, I shall not care -<br />All that you seize I shall gladly spare;<br />There is never a lock on my treasure doors,<br />Come - here are my jewels, make them yours!<br /><br />\"I am just a book on your mantel shelf,<br />But I can be part of your living self;<br />If only you\'ll travel my pages through,<br />Then I will travel the world with you.<br />As two wines blended make better wine,<br />Blend your mind with these truths of mine.<br /><br />\"I\'ll make you fitter to talk with men,<br />I\'ll touch with silver the lines you pen,<br />I\'ll lead you nearer the truth you seek,<br />I\'ll strengthen you when your faith grows weak -<br />This place on your shelf is a prison cell,<br />Let me come into your mind to dwell!&rdquo;
author: Edgar A. Guest

quote: &ldquo;Los libros no quieren ser leídos por cualquier persona, quiere ser leídos por las mejores personas, por eso buscan a sus lectores.&rdquo;
author: Juan Villoro

quote: &ldquo;And what would happen if we never read the classics? There comes a point in life, it seems to me, where you have to decide whether you\'re a Person of Letters or merely someone who loves books, and I\'m beginning to see that the book lovers have more fun. &rdquo;
author: Nick Hornby

quote: &ldquo;Books don\'t need batteries.&rdquo;
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: &ldquo;Who made you Queen of Literacy? Go sit in your car!&rdquo;
author: Jackson Pearce

quote: &ldquo;It is astounding to me, and achingly sad, that with eighty thousand people on the waiting list for donated hearts and livers and kidneys, with sixteen a day dying there on that list, that more then half of the people in the position H\'s family was in will say no, will choose to burn those organs or let them rot. We abide the surgeon\'s scalpel to save our own lives, out loved ones\' lives, but not to save a stranger\'s life. H has no heart, but heartless is the last thing you\'d call her.&rdquo;
author: Mary Roach

quote: &ldquo;Some stories have to be written because no one would believe the absurdity of it all.&rdquo;
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: &ldquo;The dirtiest book of all is the expurgated book.&rdquo;
author: Walt Whitman

quote: &ldquo;I am not a goddess. I was human once. Millions of years of evolution introduced genetic changes into our species. We found a way to traverse time, to manipulate it, to inverse it. Before the universe went into the reverse crunch, we left our physical bodies. …&rdquo;
author: Varun Sayal

quote: &ldquo;To build up a library is to create a life. It\'s never just a random collection of books.&rdquo;
author: Carlos María Domínguez

quote: &ldquo;I think it\'s the books that you read when you\'re young that live with you forever.&rdquo;
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: &ldquo;These are all novels, all about people that never existed, the people that read them it makes them unhappy with their own lives. Makes them want to live in other ways they can never really be.&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;There isn\'t any particular relationship between the messages, except that the author has chosen them carefully, so that, when seen all at once, they produce an image of life that is beautiful and surprising and deep. There is no beginning, no middle, no end, no suspense, no moral, no causes, no effects. What we love in our books are the depths of many marvelous moments seen all at one time.&rdquo;
author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

quote: &ldquo;If a book is well written, I always find it too short.&rdquo;
author: Jane Austen

quote: &ldquo;There\'s a hunger for stories in all of us, adults too. We need stories so much that we\'re even willing to read bad books to get them, if the good books won\'t supply them.&rdquo;
author: Philip Pullman

quote: &ldquo;Never did she find anything so difficult as to keep herself from losing her temper when she was suddenly disturbed while absorbed in a book.&rdquo;
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

quote: &ldquo;There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.&rdquo;
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: &ldquo;Greatness belongs to those who dare to reach for it.&rdquo;
author: Coleen Innis

quote: &ldquo;The lamp fell right on the pile of books that had been knocked from the table all in a heap, lying open. The oil spilled out, the fire immediately seized a fragile parchment, which blazed up like a bundle of dry twigs. Everything happened in a few moments, as for centuries those ancient pages had been yearning for arson and were rejoicing in the sudden satisfaction of an immemorial thirst for ecpyrosis.&rdquo;
author: Umberto Eco

quote: &ldquo;Revenge. Justice. Love. They are the three stories that all other stories are made up of. It\'s the trifecta.&rdquo;
author: April Genevieve Tucholke

quote: &ldquo;I like to read people rather than books.&rdquo;
author: Tripurari

quote: &ldquo;I think fiction at its best can serve as a moment of induced bafflement that calls into question our usual relation to things and reminds us that our minds, as nice as they are, aren\'t necessarily up to the task of living, and shouldn\'t get cocky.&rdquo;
author: George Saunders

quote: &ldquo;Books wrote our life story, and as they accumulated on our shelves (and on our windowsills, and underneath our sofa, and on top of our refrigerator), they became chapters in it themselves.&rdquo;
author: Anne Fadiman

quote: &ldquo;He can\'t take his eyes off the stars, but I can\'t take mine off his face.&rdquo;
author: Amie Kaufman

quote: &ldquo;Some say they get lost in books, but I find myself, again and again, in the pages of a good book. Humanly speaking, there is no greater teacher, no greater therapist, no greater healer of the soul, than a well-stocked library.&rdquo;
author: L.R. Knost

quote: &ldquo;More and more, I have no idea what I think of anything. It\'s as if the world were this very strange beast under a big tarp. Writing is a way of poking at the tarp. You can watch what the beast does during the poking and maybe surmise something about the sort of beast it is, but you also don\'t want to be too confident in your theories. I really like the fact that, these days, I can\'t say what writing is for, what it\'s supposed to do, or how it\'s supposed to affect us. I just like doing it.&rdquo;
author: George Saunders

quote: &ldquo;The best of a book is not the thought which it contains, but the thought which it suggests; just as the charm of music dwells not in the tones but in the echoes of our hearts.&rdquo;
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

quote: &ldquo;Read fiction to open your mind to greater possibilities and read non-fiction to learn the constraints of dreams and the facts that might guide you to attain one.&rdquo;
author: Carmine Savastano

quote: &ldquo;With no reason to hide these words I feel, and no reason to talk about the books I read, but still, I do.&rdquo;
author: Morrissey

quote: &ldquo;I\'d recently finished reading a management tome which seemed to be aimed at psychopaths with no common sense (quite a dangerous combination).&rdquo;
author: Gail Honeyman

quote: &ldquo;I have all the books I could need, and what more could I need than books?&rdquo;
author: Catherynne M. Valente

quote: &ldquo;Your library is a reflection of your ideal self&rdquo;
author: Goodreads on Facebook

quote: &ldquo;A book is a version of the world. If you do not like it, ignore it; or offer your own version in return.&rdquo;
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: &ldquo;Teenagers read millions of books every year. They read for entertainment and for education. They read because of school assignments and pop culture fads.<br /><p><br /> And there are millions of teens who read because they are sad and lonely and enraged. They read because they live in an often-terrible world. They read because they believe despite the callow protestations of certain adults that books-especially the dark and dangerous ones-will save them.</p>&rdquo;
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: &ldquo;He loved books, those undemanding but faithful friends.&rdquo;
author: Victor Hugo

quote: &ldquo;Goodhue wanted visitors to feel more than they were in a pretty building. He wanted them to feel they were part of a three-dimensional meditation on the power of human intellect and the potency of storytelling.&rdquo;
author: Susan Orlean

quote: &ldquo;Teaching others, he corrected himself.&rdquo;
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: &ldquo;But maybe they understood more about life than I did. From an early age they knew what little value the world placed in books, and so didn\'t waste their time with them. Whereas I, even now, persist in believing that these black marks on white paper bear the greatest significance, that if I keep writing, I might be able to catch the rainbow of consciousness in a jar.&rdquo;
author: Jeffrey Eugenides

quote: &ldquo;I took to the Bodleian library as to a lover and ... would sit long hours in Bodley\'s arms to emerge, blinking and dazed with the smell and feel of all those books.&rdquo;
author: Laurie R. King

quote: &ldquo;Old books that we have known but not possessed cross our path and invite themselves over. New books try to seduce us daily with tempting titles and tantalizing covers. &rdquo;
author: Alberto Manguel

quote: &ldquo;A book is a mirror: if an ape looks into it an apostle is hardly likely to look out.&rdquo;
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: &ldquo;these books are my good friends&rdquo;
author: Bram Stoker

quote: &ldquo;For the last several days I\'ve had the sudden and general urge to buy a new book. I\'ve stopped off at a few bookstores around the city, and while I\'ve looked at hundreds and hundreds of books in that time, I have not found the one book that will satisfy my urge. It\'s not as if I don\'t have anything to read; there\'s a tower of perfectly good unread books next to my bed, not to mention the shelves of books in the living room I\'ve been meaning to reread. I find myself, maddeningly, hungry for the next one, as yet unknown. I no longer try to analyze this hunger; I capitulated long ago to the book lust that\'s afflicted me most of my life. I know enough about the course of the disease to know I\'ll discover something soon.&rdquo;
author: Lewis Buzbee

quote: &ldquo;An honest bookstore would post the following sign above its \'self-help\' section: \'For true self-help, please visit our philosophy, literature, history and science sections, find yourself a good book, read it, and think about it.&rdquo;
author: Roger Ebert

quote: &ldquo;I think one should never be too busy to teach those who are anxious to learn.&rdquo;
author: Penelope Fitzgerald

quote: &ldquo;That\'s the thing about a great book. Every time you read it, it\'s different, because you\'re different. You\'ve changed since the last time you picked it up, things have happened to you.&rdquo;
author: Jessica Zafra

quote: &ldquo;Books are for nothing but to inspire&rdquo;
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: &ldquo;A monk should surely love his books with humility, wishing their good and not the glory of his own curiosity; but what the temptation of adultery is for laymen and the yearning for riches is for secular ecclesiastics, the seduction of knowledge is for monks.&rdquo;
author: Umberto Eco

quote: &ldquo;Dismissed like a dog. Damon groped for his jacket behind him, found it, and wished that his groping for his sense of humor could be as successful. The faces around him were all the same. They could have been carved in stone.<br />But not stone as hard as that that was coming together again around his soul. That rock was remarkably quick to mend-and an extra layer was added, like the layering of a pearl, but not covering anything nearly so pretty.&rdquo;
author: L.J. Smith

quote: &ldquo;Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you have finished just to stay near it&rdquo;
author: Markus Zusak

quote: &ldquo;All books are either dreams or swords,<br />You can cut, or you can drug, with words. &rdquo;
author: Amy Lowell

quote: &ldquo;Several times he had to flatten himself against the shelves as a thesaurus thundered by. He waited patiently as a herd of Critters crawled past, grazing on the contents of the choicer books and leaving behind them piles of small slim volumes of literary criticism.&rdquo;
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: &ldquo;When you lose yourself in a book the hours grow wings and fly.&rdquo;
author: Chloe Thurlow

quote: &ldquo;A fool may buy all the books in the world, and they will be in his library; but he will be able to read only those that he deserves to.&rdquo;
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: &ldquo;Good books make you ask questions. Bad readers want everything answered.&rdquo;
author: Scott Westerfeld

quote: &ldquo;Books tend to react with one another, creating randomized magic with a mind of its own.&rdquo;
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: &ldquo;No book is dangerous in and of itself, you know. But historically, reading a book in the wrong way has led to terrible consequences.&rdquo;
author: Edgar Cantero

quote: &ldquo;Don\'t forget, and don\'t let your reader forget, that the small world in which you have held him for the last hour or two hasn\'t ended. Be aware, and make him aware, that tomorrow all of its remaining inhabitants will pick up the broken fragments of their lives, and carry on.&rdquo;
author: Joseph Hansen

quote: &ldquo;Overhyped books are the empty calories of the literary world.&rdquo;
author: Kevin Ansbro

quote: &ldquo;Look,\' he says, \'have you ever looked forward to reading a book so much you can\'t actually start it?\'<br />\'Oh totally. All the time - if I had a grain of self-restraint I never would\'ve been able to read the last Harry Potter book. The anticipation was painful. You know like what if it does live up to the last ones? What if it\'s not what I hope it\'ll be?&rdquo;
author: Beth O'Leary

quote: &ldquo;... And the only way to find that honesty is to not overthink it.<br /><br />For your writing to come alive--to be multi-dimensional--you must barter away some control.&rdquo;
author: Elizabeth Sims

quote: &ldquo;I love books. If they are good books, I love them even more. But even if they are bad books, I still love them.&rdquo;
author: Hugo Chávez

quote: &ldquo;After all, a town without a bookshop was a town without a heart.&rdquo;
author: Veronica Henry

quote: &ldquo;Browsing through the shelves in bookstores or libraries, I was completely happy.&rdquo;
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: &ldquo;Much later, Alice would wonder what might have happened if she had gone to bed when she was supposed to.&rdquo;
author: Django Wexler

quote: &ldquo;Far be it from me to keep a woman from her book. That could become dangerous.&rdquo;
author: Elizabeth   Hunter

quote: &ldquo;Books, in the plural lose their solidity of substance and become a gas, filling all available space.&rdquo;
author: John Derbyshire

quote: &ldquo;Lost in a Quatrain - the state of being deep in thought, contemplative...&rdquo;
author: Adiela Akoo

quote: &ldquo;No book is really worth reading at the age of 10 which is not equally worth reading at the age of 50.&rdquo;
author: Gladys M. Hunt

quote: &ldquo;Libraries can in general be too narrow or too wide for the soul.&rdquo;
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: &ldquo;My books are a word feast.&rdquo;
author: Lori R. Lopez

quote: &ldquo;What\'s the use trying to read Shakespeare, especially in one of those little paper editions whose pages get ruffled, or stuck together with sea-water?&rdquo;
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: &ldquo;Men have had every advantage of us in telling their own story. Education has been theirs in so much higher a degree; the pen has been in their hands. I will not allow books to prove anything.&rdquo;
author: Jane Austen

quote: &ldquo;And if our book consumption remains as low as it has been, at least let us admit that it is because reading is a less exciting pastime than going to the dogs, the pictures or the pub, and not because books, whether bought or borrowed, are too expensive.&rdquo;
author: George Orwell

quote: &ldquo;The flickering candlelight conspired with the silence, and we only interrupted each other\'s reading to share a casual delight.&rdquo;
author: Keith Donohue

quote: &ldquo;Thus far, the only people who can grant you immortality are not scientists, but writers. By writing you into their books, they may not only immortalize you, but also grant you superpowers.&rdquo;
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: &ldquo;What if people don\'t like it? What if they don\'t even take the chance to read it, but they hate us for what\'s inside of it?&rdquo;
author: Anna Todd

quote: &ldquo;Os livros mudam o destino das pessoas&rdquo;
author: Carlos María Domínguez

quote: &ldquo;The imaginary is not formed in opposition to reality as its denial or compensation; it grows among signs, from book to book, in the interstice of repetitions and commentaries; it is born and takes shape in the interval between books. It is the phenomena of the library.&rdquo;
author: Michel Foucault

quote: &ldquo;Surely it is better, thought Domenica, that forty-five should buy the book and actually read it, than should many thousands, indeed millions, buy it and put it on their shelves, like...Professor Hawking\'s Brief History of Time. That was a book that had been bought by millions, but had been demonstrated to have been read by only a minute proportion of those who had acquired it. For do we not all have a copy of that on our shelves, and who amongst us can claim to have read beyond the first page, in spite of the pellucid prose of its author and his evident desire to share with us his knowledge of...of whatever it is that the book is about?&rdquo;
author: Alexander McCall Smith

quote: &ldquo;Spray a book with insect spray, drop it in a bag, add some mothballs and seal it. Put it in another bag and seal it. Another. The packages piled up on the floor, each a book sealed in four plastic envelopes.&rdquo;
author: Larry Niven

quote: &ldquo;A writer can create a more just world in books by shining a light on that injustice.&rdquo;
author: Yang Huang

quote: &ldquo;I regained my soul through literature after those times I\'d lost it to wild-eyed gypsy girls on the European streets.&rdquo;
author: Roman Payne

quote: &ldquo;O livro é um pássaro com mais de cem asas para voar.&rdquo;
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna

quote: &ldquo;In books I meet the dead as if they were alive,<br />in books I see what is yet to come...<br />All things decay and pass with time...<br />all fame would fall victim to oblivion<br />if God had not given mortal men the book to aid them.&rdquo;
author: Richard de Bury

quote: &ldquo;Whenever we talk about darkness and light, the terms seem so abstract that many consider the answers to be found in meditation and yoga, but I\'m here to tell you that the answers are in the books you will never read, waiting all your life in the libraries you ignored and the bookstores you didn\'t visit. I\'m here to tell you as well that you are your own Satan and evil can\'t possibly interfere more in your life than what you\'re already doing to yourself by remaining ignorant. Until you choose the light, darkness is your personal choice, and there\'s no reason to feel any empathy for you.&rdquo;
author: Robin Sacredfire

quote: &ldquo;I could read the great books but the great books don\'t interest me.&rdquo;
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: &ldquo;For I need not remind such an audience as this that the neat sorting out of books into age-groups, so dear to publishers, has only a very sketchy relation with the habits of any real readers. Those of us who are blamed when old for reading childish books were blamed when children for reading books too old for us. No reader worth his salt trots along in obedience to a time-table.&rdquo;
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: &ldquo;Books whose topics I thoroughy depsise are accapteble because they often force the reader to think and to examine his own beliefs. In an age where most people are either blindly obedient or radical, exposing oneself to the ideas contained in even the most controversial of books is a good thing.&rdquo;
author: Tiffini Johnson

quote: &ldquo;Hicks szemügyre vette a könyveket, amiket Maura begyűjtött a polcokról: Peter Straub, Clive Barker, Joe Hill.<br />- Ezek horrortörténetek! - kiáltott fel. - Hagyjuk, hogy az elítéltek ilyesmit olvassanak?<br />- Csak ezt olvassák, meg a romantikus regényeket, uram - jelentette ki Maura (...).&rdquo;
author: Stephen King

quote: &ldquo;Books were only one type of receptacle where we stored a lot of things we were afraid we might forget. There is nothing magical in them at all. The magic is only in what books say, how they stitched the patches of the Universe together into one garment for us.&rdquo;
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: &ldquo;Biblioteki są zapisami naszych czytelniczych porażek.<br />Jak mało w nich książek, które naprawdę nam się podobały. Jeszcze mniej takich, które podobają się nam przy kolejnej lekturze. Większość to pamiątki po ludziach, którymi chcieliśmy być. Których udawaliśmy. Których braliśmy za siebie.&rdquo;
author: Marcin Wicha

quote: &ldquo;I found out that, paradoxically, a book can be bigger than the internet. The very constraints of a book - its linearity, its lack of updates - are also its greatest strengths. I can be far more confident that each reader will have a roughly similar experience of a book, rather than spidering off in all directions as with hypertext. ....But with a book, I have the luxury of being able to take people through a sequence of chapters, letting ideas build on top of each other, developing a fuller argument. It\'s a smaller space, but it can support bigger ideas.&rdquo;
author: John Scalzi

quote: &ldquo;London, December 1915. In the master bedroom (never was the estate agent\'s epithet more appropriate) of Flat 21, Carlyle Mansions, Cheyne Walk, Chelsea, the distinguished author is dying - slowly, but surely. In Flanders, less than two hundred miles away, other men are dying more quickly, more painfully, more pitifully - young men, mostly, with their lives still before them, blank pages that will never be filled. The author is seventy-two. He has had an interesting and varied life, written many books, travelled widely, enjoyed the arts, moved in society (one winter he dined out 107 times), and owns a charming old house in Rye as well as the lease of this spacious London flat with its fine view of the Thames. He has had deeply rewarding friendships with both men and women. If he has never experienced sexual intercourse, that was by his own choice, unlike the many young men in Flanders who died virgins either for lack of opportunity or because they hoped to marry and were keeping themselves chaste on principle.&rdquo;
author: David Lodge

quote: &ldquo;Art, he said, was a controlled madness...He said that books weren\'t made of themes, which you could write essays about, but of images that inserted themselves into your brain and replaced what you were seeing with your eyes.&rdquo;
author: Steven Millhauser

quote: &ldquo;A good book is the precious life-blood of a master-spirit, embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life, and as such it must surely be a necessary commodity.&rdquo;
author: Penelope Fitzgerald

quote: &ldquo;Her seven-year-old self had decided that stealing books was morally bankrupt, but since the books hadn\'t actually left the library-they\'d merely been relocated-it wasn\'t technically stealing. Echo looked around at her sea of tomes, and a single word came to mind: Tsundoku. It was the Japanese word for letting books pile up without reading them all.&rdquo;
author: Melissa Grey

quote: &ldquo;All books have magical properties.&rdquo;
author: Jaclyn Moriarty

quote: &ldquo;If you grew up in a rural area, you have seen how farmhouses come and go, but the dent left by cellars is permanent. There is something unbreakable in that hand-dug foundational gouge into the earth. Books are the cellars of civilization: when cultures crumble away, their books remain out of sheer stupid solidity.&rdquo;
author: Paul  Collins

quote: &ldquo;Shelby watched the books burn. She wonders if words are pouring down on other people\'s houses,sad words, like beast and mourn and sorrow and mother.&rdquo;
author: Alice Hoffman

quote: &ldquo;This is no book. Whoever touches this touches a man.&rdquo;
author: Ezra Pound

quote: &ldquo;A bad book about the love of God remains a bad book, even though it may be about the love of God. There are many who think that because they have written about God, they have written good books. Then men pick up these books and say: if the ones who say they believe in God cannot find anything better than this to say about it, their religion cannot be worth much.&rdquo;
author: Thomas Merton

quote: &ldquo;Books can change the world. They represent a second chance for those that want to change their life and can\'t.&rdquo;
author: Robin Sacredfire

quote: &ldquo;<i>They were alive and they spoke to me!</i> That is the simplest and most eloquent way in which I can refer to those authors who have remained with me over the years.&rdquo;
author: Henry Miller

quote: &ldquo;The title of the work, its place in the collective library, the nature of the person who tells us about it, the atmosphere established in the written or spoken exhange, among many other instances, offer alternatives to the book itself that allow us to talk about ourselves without dwelling upon the work too closely.&rdquo;
author: Pierre Bayard

quote: &ldquo;Dear and most respected bookcase! I welcome your existence, which has for over one hundred years been devoted to the radiant ideals of goodness and justice.&rdquo;
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: &ldquo;Its emptiness is more than the lack of living, breathing beings. It is the unread pages of the many books that reside on the shelves throughout the room I should hot have thought one could tell when books have gone unread, but after the company of Birchwood\'s well-loved library it is as if I can hear these books whispering, their pages grasping and reaching for an audience.&rdquo;
author: Michelle Zink

quote: &ldquo;Not that she objected to solitude. Quite the contrary. She had books, thank Heaven, quantities of books. All sorts of books.&rdquo;
author: Jean Rhys

quote: &ldquo;Systematisches Lesen ist kaum von Nutzen.
